DOC.brief_title: Intensive Diet Exercise Standard Care Improving Physical Function Quality Life Patients With Prostate Cancer Undergoing Androgen Deprivation Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To compare effect intensive lifestyle intervention standard care treatment functional limitation ( FL ) , body composition ( BC ) , quality life ( QOL ) prostate cancer ( PC ) patient androgen deprivation therapy ( ADT ) . II . To determine feasibility deliver intensive lifestyle exercise dietary intervention PC patient undergoing ADT . III . To identify intermediate variable account beneficial effect lifestyle intervention functional limitation QOL . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I : EXERCISE COMPONENT : Patients undergo 1 hour intensive exercise comprise 30 minute aerobic exercise 30 minute resistance exercise twice weekly week 1-6 , weekly week 7-8 , independently week 7-12 . BEHAVIORAL ACTIVITY COUNSELING : Patients undergo behavioral activity counsel small group session 20 minute weekly month 1-2 individualized activity counsel via telephone call 20 minute every 2 week 3 month . DIETARY COMPONENT : Patients undergo nutritional counseling 30 minute weekly month 1-2 every 2 week via telephone call month 3 . ARM II : Patients receive standard care educational literature describe American Institute Cancer Research dietary physical activity guideline . Patients also receive phone call 20 minute every 2 week 3 month focus routine prostate cancer self-management . After 3 month , patient undergo 2 supervised exercise training dietary counseling session .
